column4: After a clean install of Ubuntu, my input mic works, my spdif headphone socket works, but my speakers don't.  On Acer 9810 lappy btw. Anyone got any ideas?!?
I've done all of the obvious things such ash mute, faders, choosing the right device etc....
can you give the output of:wget -O alsa-info.sh http://www.alsa-project.org/alsa-info.sh && chmod +x ./alsa-info.sh && ./alsa-info.sh
http://www.alsa-project.org/db/?f=e9a11dbe4b2b5aa7b497aec44f221769fb066a3b
have you tried changing the model to laptop in alsa-base.conf ?
How would I do that?
gksudo gedit /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base.conf     change the line and reboot
I have the file open but can't see a line that pertains to the model
ok, if you close gedit then run:  grep -R model /etc/modprobe.d/*     what is output?
if it gives multiple lines, use a pastebin
can you pastebin the output of the command I gave please
http://paste.ubuntu.com/1024746/
the 3 files listed do nothing as they don't have a .conf extension, I suggest you delete them
Is that just general housekeeping or could that fix my sound problem too?
good house keeping, you can then add the line:  options snd-hda-intel model=laptop    in /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base.conf
Just to be clear, the files I should be deleting are:  etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base:options  AND etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base~:options AND /etc/modprobe.d/options:options  ??
sudo rm /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base~; sudo rm /etc/modprobe.d/options; sudo rm /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base
the colon stuff is  the result of grep
Ok thanks. Going to reboot now and see if it worked
I have deleted the files, added the line and rebooted but still no sound :(
try the original model line, but set it in alsa-base.conf. Change the line you added
Thanks for all the help.
